title.narrative: Ghana - Maternal, Child Health and Nutrition Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve utilization of community-based health and nutrition services by women of reproductive age, especially pregnant women, and children under the age of 2 years.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement: Recruitment of Independent Verification Agent | Description: The Recipient shall, not later than four months (4)months after the Effective Date, engage, in accordance with the provisions of Section III of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement,consultants to conduct independent verifications of the delivery of the package of maternal health services (PMHS) by respectivecommunity health teams under the community-based Performance-Based Financing (CPBF) Program. | Due Date :01-June 30, 2015

title.narrative: Number of women and children who have received basic nutrition services
People who have received essential health, nutrition, and population (HNP) services
Number of deliveries attended by skilled health personnel
Community-based Planning and Services Zones receiving supervision visits from Sub-District level
Children under two receiving at least one CIYCF visit per month
Community health personnel trained in approved in-service curriculum and upgrade training
Births (deliveries) attended by skilled health personnel (annual, cumulative)
Women receiving post-natal care within 48 hours at PHC level
Pregnant women making the first antenatal visit before the fourth month of pregnancy at PHC level
New female acceptors (15-49 years) of modern family planning methods
Stock out of essential commodities at PHC level
Home visits conducted in the community
Community satisfaction with the utilization of the essential package of services
Completeness of Integrated disease surveillance report (IDSR) report
Children under five years with diarrhea treated in the two weeks preceding the survey given ORT
Children age 12 months to 23 months that are immunized measles 2 (PHC level)
Attendants with NHIS at PHC level
Persons receiving essential package of PHC services
Functional public health emergency management centre established
New national policy for PHC package developed
Births attended by skilled health personnel at PHC level
Pregnant women making first antenatal visit in the first trimester at PHC level (percent at PHC level)
